description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"82qta","text":"LIbrary preparation for population-scale Oxford Nanopore long-read DNA sequencing SOP


At the NIH's Center for Alzheimer's and Related Dementias (CARD) https://card.nih.gov/research-programs/long-read-sequencing we will generate long-read sequencing data from thousands of patients with Alzheimer's disease, frontotemporal dementia, Lewy body dementia, and healthy subjects. With this research, we will build a public resource consisting of long-read genome sequencing data from a large number of confirmed people with Alzheimer's disease and related dementias and healthy individuals. To generate this large-scale nanopore sequencing data we have developed a protocol for processing and long-read sequencing human frontal cortex brain tissue, targeting an N50 of  ~30kb and ~30X coverage.   


†Correspondence to: Kimberley Billingsley billingsleykj@nih.gov


Acknowledgements:
We would like to thank the Nanopore team (Jade Bartolo, Olivor Holman, Androo Markham & Jessica Anderson) and Hamilton team (Kristen Hise) and the whole CARD long-read team listed below => UCSC: Benedict Paten, Trevor Pesout, Paolo Carnevali, Mira Mastoras, Melissa Meredith, Jean Monlong, Ryan Lorig-Roach, Mobin Asri; NE: Miten Jain; NCI: Mikhail Kolmogorov; NHGRI: Adam Phillippy, Arang Rhie; Baylor: Fritz Sedlazeck, Farhang Jaryani; JHU: Winston Timp; NIA: Cornelis Blauwendraat, Kimberley Billingsley, Pilar Alvarez Jerez, Laksh Malik, Breeana Baker, Maysa Abdelhalim, Kensuke Daida, Rylee Genner,  Abigail Miano-Burkhardt, Caroline status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3u9rp","text":"Part 1: Sample Preparation and Instrument Initialization","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":56}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64rid","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qnro","text":"Note: The CARD team has spent ~10 months optimizing this protocol for use with 48 brain or blood samples, so some optimizations may be specific to our samples and desired sequencing output. Therefore additional optimization is likely needed for new users.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi2hn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8m10a","text":"Place all the necessary reagents on ice to thaw and the Agencourt AMPure XP Beads out at room temperature. Prepare samples on a 96-well HSP PCR plate (see Materials) and spin down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dq3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3dpq2","text":"Note: It is important that each well that will be used contains exactly  . Incorrect volumes can cause cascading failures during the run.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":72,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"15q4j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ckg8","text":"Carefully remove UV cover and open up the Method Manager application on the Hamilton computer and allow the Hamilton to initialize. Start Daily Maintenance. Once a week, also perform the Weekly Maintenance. Click through the prompts as they populate on the application.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aspo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evt56","text":"Note: In our experience, AMPure XP beads and Short Fragment Buffer (SFB) perform best when thawed and used at room temperature rather than on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"48","error":false,"guid":"90126EE0320011EE8F503F70420874A6","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3pp86","text":"Part 2: End-Prep (~1 hour 15 minutes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a904","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3i9rg","text":"Start the LSK 114 v1.0 protocol and select \"Process01: DNA repair and end-prep\" for the start process, and \"Process02: DNA repair and end-prep clean-up\" for the stop process. Follow the prompts on the screen to select the number of samples to run and to begin setting up the deck. It is very important to never \"lie\" to the Hamilton. (add example)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuprf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27jhv","text":"Note: The LSK 114 v1.0 protocol is a slightly modified version of ONT's original protocol \"OxfordNanopore_LSK114_MPH_v1.0\". The only modification is the final incubation at the end, which has been changed to match the CARD manual library preparation protocol (  at   at 300-450 x g).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":260,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":265,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"22770E2A308611EEBCEA0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"22770EC8308611EEBCEA0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"92rqe","text":"Part 3: Adapter Ligation (~1 hour 45 minutes)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4dqtt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8eu4","text":"Start the LSK 114 v1.0 protocol and select \"Process03: Adapter ligation\" for the start process, and \"Process04: Adapter ligation clean-up\" for the stop process. Follow the prompts on the screen to select the number of samples to run and to begin setting up the deck.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5prjv","text":"Part 4: Instrument Clean-Up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"502o8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brrgr","text":"Once Process04 has completed, the Hamilton will prompt the user to remove their samples so that it can begin cleaning-up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5he1u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d802g","text":"The libraries can now proceed with sequencing. They can alternatively be stored at   for ~2 weeks or   for ~3 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":83,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":101,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a0mbv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq428","text":"When the instrument has finished, restock all consumables on deck so that instrument is prepared for the next run. Put UV cover back on, and start UV protocol for at least 3 minutes (our lab runs the UV for 30 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"163CAF80308A11EE9CA0B766EB7655B9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"277197C0308A11EE9CA0B766EB7655B9","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-20","unit":10}}}}
